alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:31PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yuma County through 900 PM MDT... At 831 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Eckley, or 9 miles southwest of Wray, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Yuma County, including the following locations... Hale, Beecher Island and Kirk. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 207 and 210, and between mile markers 212 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
